Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk ipa-admintools
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: ipa and mod_auth_gssapi bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: Red Hat Identity Management (IdM) is a centralized authentication, identity management, and authorization solution for both traditional and cloud-based enterprise environments. The mod_auth_gssapi module is a Generic Security Services API (GSSAPI) authentication module for Apache. It implements an HTTP authentication protocol based on the Simple and Protected GSSAPI Negotiation Mechanism (SPNEGO). This update fixes the following bug in both the ipa and mod_auth_gssapi packages: Previously, in case of multiple concurrent remote procedure call (RPC) requests of the same principal, a race condition occurred on the IdM server. After the first request finished, it deleted the credential cache (ccache) for the principal. Then, if the second request tried to use the ccache, the attempt failed. For example, this problem could cause two concurrent ipa-client-install operations to fail. With this update, unique ccache names are now used on the server instead of ccache names derived from the principal name. As a result, only one ccache exists for each request, which avoids the described conflicts in ccache names and ensures that multiple concurrent RPC requests on the same principal work as expected. (BZ#1347175, BZ#1350305) Users of ipa and mod_auth_gssapi are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
